comment.body: Reproductive build is the answer to this but it imply open source and independent review.
ahhhh! plzzzz I try to keep a bit of hope :p
we are doomed, we are fucking doomed

Putting the  operator in front help to make clear that the line is part of a statement evaluation.

`if (starts_with(path, home, path_size, home_path_size) `
` ....    || check_with(path, home, path_size, home_path_size) {`
`....     recreate(path, home);`
` ....    return home_path_size;`
` } else {`
`  ....   return 0;`
` }`


I also once literaly saw someone not tabbing the second row of the statement from the point of view that it's not inside the brackets and should not be tabbed.
